result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridget C. Griep was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences Ms. Griep to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges for work and treatment purposes.  Transfer of the service of this jail term to another county is allowed, however there is not to be any use of electronic monitoring. The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Ms. Griep on Probation for one year

--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bridget C. Griep

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 4:50pm 
Defendant Bridget C. Griep in court with Attorney Kayla Barteck.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Court vacates the warrant authorization ordered earlier today.  

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Ms. Griep to serve 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges for work and treatment purposes.  Transfer of the service of this jail term to another county is allowed, however there is not to be any use of electronic monitoring.  
Days credit for time already served:  7 days

The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Ms. Griep on Probation for one year, with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1
--no contact with Victim 1's residence
--to engage in any assessment, treatment or counseling per Agent
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program per Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs, fees, surcharges [clerk's calculation of the amount $453] 
The Court requires Ms. Griep to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by 12:00pm on Monday [June 13]. 
recess 5:10pm

[MK] case called at 11:00am 
Defendant Bridget C. Griep does not appear. Attorney Kayla Barteck.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock verifies victim rights compliance; there is no victim present.
Attorney Barteck indicates that the Defense intends to proceed to plea and sentencing today, however Ms. Griep contacted her to say that the family member who was to transport her this morning had a medical emergency.  Attorney Barteck proposes rescheduling to the afternoon.  
The Court authorizes a Warrant but stays its issuance until 3:30pm today; Ms. Griep will need to be here in person at that time.  
recess 11:03am  

NEXT: Hearing at 3:30pm today

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on June 1, 2022 at 10:40 am.
Status conference on June 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions of this bond include:
--no discussion of the case with Victim 1
--no presence at Victim 1's residence

[ml] Case called at 1:16PM
Defendant Bridget C. Griep appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Amber Rumpf (the PD will appoint counsel).  ADA Krysta Parson appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "Not Guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by the Defendant.

The Court requires a $750.00 Signature Bond with conditions:
--no discussion of the case with Victim 1
--no presence at Victim 1's residence

The Court inquires if there victim present that wishes to be heard. There is no response.

recess 1:23PM

NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 06/01 at 10:40AM  (2) Status Conference on 06/10 at 9:30AM with in person appearances

[ae] case called 11:26 AM Defendant Bridget C. Griep not in court.  ADA Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State requests that a probable cause warrant be issued. Upon review of the file the Court finds probable cause and issues warrant body only.  
Recess 11:26 AM
Defendant has pending case assigned to Branch 1
